headline: Southwest Overhauls Seating And Fees As Profit Targets Soar For 2026
summary: Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) has ended its 54 year open seating policy. The carrier is moving to assigned seating, adding extra legroom and basic economy fare options. The company is introducing bag fees and has outlined a plan it projects could support a fourfold profit increase in 2026. For an airline long defined by its first come, first served boarding process, this is a significant reset of how Southwest operates. The company has built its brand around simplicity and a relatively...

headline: Southwest Airlines (LUV) Posts $7.4B Revenue for Q4 2025 as EPS Beats Guidance
summary: Southwest Airlines Co (NYSE:LUV) is one of the most undervalued stocks to buy and hold for 5 years. On January 29, Southwest Airlines Co (NYSE:LUV) reported an EPS of $0.58 for the fourth quarter of 2025, slightly above its $0.57 guidance for the period, as well as $7.4 billion in revenues, slightly missing its $7.5 […]
